result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew T Badgett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: EACH COUNT: Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge as a condition of extended supervision in 15CF3021. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence.
Court ordered a total of 519 days credit:
183 days on Count 3, 183 days on Count 4, and 153 days on case 15CF3021.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
Consecutive to: consecutive to count 3 and to any other sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew T Badgett

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew T Badgett in court with attorney Cole J White.  Defendant Matthew T Badgett in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  A PSI has been prepared for companion case 15CF3021.  Sentencing statements to the court by state, defense and defendant.  Additional statement by Shamika C.  Defendant has a TOTAL of 519 days of credit.
As to count 3:    The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 183 days time served.  
As to count 4:    The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 3 and to any other sentence with credit for 183 days time served.  
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge as a condition of extended supervision in 15CF3021. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
PSI emailed to ADA DeSiato and Atty White

Defendant Matthew T Badgett in court with attorney Cole J White.  Defendant Matthew T Badgett in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk: LMS.

The request for a PSI was not submitted therefore the sentencing has to be adjourned.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 38.

  All parties notified, effective August 1, 2016 this case is assigned to Judge Jeffrey Wagner, Branch 38, in room 423 in the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Matthew T Badgett in court with attorney Cole J White.  Defendant Matthew T Badgett in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

COUNTS 3 & 4:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and Jury instruction received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint.  Judgment of conviction entered.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

COUNTS 1 & 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 1 & 2 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 6.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew T Badgett in court with attorney Cole J White.  Defendant Matthew T Badgett in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Parties have reached a resolution.    Defense request a plea date.  Case is adjourned for a PLEA HEARING in branch 6.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

received and filed. lms

Defense presented State with a resolution to consider.  State believes case can be resolved short of trial.  

  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Case is here for Final pretrial.  State is asking to adjourned Jury Trial date due to the unavailability of an officer.  Defense has no objection to the adjournment.  Defense waives speedy Trial demand request.  Court order Jury Trial date of March 7, 2016 vacated.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.
State's Motion to Introduce Victim's Statements Under the Doctrine of Forfeiture by Wrongdoing, received and filed.

Defendant Matthew T Badgett in court with attorney Cole J White.  Defendant Matthew T Badgett in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Parties had off the record discussions with the judge.  Defense received discovery 2nd week in December but realized he didn't have the digital copies which included the photos, statements and phone calls.  Defense request an adjournment.  Court GRANTS request.  State has no objection.

Case is adjourned for FINAL PRETRIAL and JURY TRIAL in branch 6.  Motion to be addressed at the final pretrial date.  State's Forfeiture by Wrongdoing to be filed by 1/20/2016, and defense response by 2/3/2016.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant Matthew T Badgett in court with attorney Cole J White.  Defendant Matthew T Badgett in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

New counsel has been recently retained.  Defense needs the file from previous counsel.  Case remains in trial posture.  Victim has been subpoenaed, but has become uncooperative.  

State estimates calling 6 witnesses and defense to call an additional 2 witnesses.  Parties stipulation to 11 relevant convictions for the defense.  State will leave their offer open and will allow a counter offer.  Court order plea negotiations remain open.

State's motion for special instruction heard; defense has no objection.  The Court to revisit issue on the next date.
